name: Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Add eggs and milk. Mix until smooth.
Heat a griddle over medium heat and lightly grease.
Pour batter onto griddle. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden brown.

name: Greek Yogurt Smoothie
instructions: Combine Greek yogurt, banana, berries, honey, and milk in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

name: Caesar Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, toss together lettuce, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat.
Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking up the meat with a spoon.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine (if using), beef broth, oregano, basil, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Simmer the sauce for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Adjust seasoning as needed.
Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over the spaghetti, garnished with fresh basil or parsley and grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

name: Lasagne
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
Add ground beef and pork. Cook until browned, breaking up the meat with a spoon.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Simmer the sauce for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Adjust seasoning as needed.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat for the cheese sauce.
Stir in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes to form a roux.
Gradually whisk in milk, ensuring no lumps form. Cook until the sauce thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Mix until smooth.
Cook the lasagne noodles according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and lay them out on a baking sheet.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Spread a thin layer of meat sauce on the bottom of a baking dish.
Place a layer of lasagne noodles over the sauce.
Spread a portion of cheese sauce over the noodles.
Repeat layers, ending with a layer of cheese sauce on top.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan and shredded mozzarella.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the top is golden and bubbly.
Let the lasagne rest for at least 15 minutes before serving.

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, garlic, ginger, cornstarch, and chicken broth. Set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add bell peppers and broccoli. Stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Return chicken to the skillet. Pour in the sauce and stir until everything is well coated and the sauce has thickened.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds if desired. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

name: Seafood Boil
instructions: Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
Add Old Bay seasoning and garlic to the boiling water.
Add potatoes and cook for 10 minutes.
Add corn and sausage to the pot. Cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Add crab legs, clams, and mussels. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes.
Drain the seafood and vegetables. Transfer to a large serving tray.
Drizzle with melted butter and squeeze lemon over the top.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

name: Beef Stew
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add beef cubes and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Add chopped onions and garlic to the pot. Cook until softened.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Return beef to the pot. Add beef broth, red wine (if using), thyme, bay leaves, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Add carrots and potatoes. Continue simmering until beef and vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes.
Stir in frozen peas and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove bay leaves and serve hot.

name: Chicken Stew

ingredients.quantity: 1.5 lbs (680g), boneless and skinless, cut into chunks

instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chicken chunks and cook until browned on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add chopped onions and garlic. Cook until softened.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Return chicken to the pot. Add chicken broth, thyme, rosemary, bay leaves, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add carrots and potatoes. Continue simmering until chicken and vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in frozen peas and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove bay leaves and serve hot.
